#Text=Israeli President chooses Likud leader to form the 18th
#Text=Knesset government
#Text=Friday , February 20 , 2009
#Text=Benjamin " Bibi " Netanyahu
#Text=( בִּנְיָמִין " ביבי " נְתַנְיָהוּ ) was the 9th Prime Minister of Israel and is Chairman of the Likud Party .
#Text=Today , Israel President Shimon Peres has selected Likud leader Benjamin Netanyahu to form the government of the 18th Knesset .
#Text=65 Members of Knesset informed the President of their preference of Netanyahu to head the government .
#Text=President Peres was persuaded by two factors to choose Likud over Kadima .
#Text=The Yisrael Beiteinu ( Israel Our Home ) supports Likud in its attempt to form a government .
#Text=Kadima Leader Tzipi Livni would not join in a unity government with Likud that the Israel President was attempting to broker between the three largest parties .
#Text=It appears that the coalition which has been formed in recent days lacks diplomatic vision . ( A ) broad coalition is worthless if it is not governed by values .
#Text=— Tzipi Livnivia JPost.com
#Text=Kadima had won a plurality of the seats ( 28 ) in Knesset , the Israel parliament , in the February 10th election beating out the right-wing Likud Party by one seat .
#Text=Livini met with Beiteinu party leader Avigdor Lieberman in an attempt to form the core of an new coalition government .
#Text=Kadima was expecting to be able to form a government with Labor ( 13 seats ) , Meretz and New Movement ( 3 seats ) and Beiteinu ( 15 seats ) .
#Text=This coalition would have 59 seats , but now without Beiteinu only 44 seats making either combination 2 seats or 17 seats short of a majority .
#Text=Beiteinu won 15 seats in the election — the third most seats — making it key to the make up of the government .
#Text=It ran on a plank of loyalty oaths to Israel from Israel 's Arab citizens or have their citizens lost .
#Text=The initial government coalition of Likud and Beiteinu combined has 44 seats just 19 seats short of a majority .

#Text=After official results are published ( on February 18 , in this election ) , the President of Israel delegates the task of forming a government to the member of Knesset with the best chance of assembling a majority coalition ( usually the leader of the largest party . )
#Text=That designee has up to 42 days to negotiate with the different parties , and then present his government to the Knesset for a vote of confidence .
#Text=Once the government is approved ( by a vote of at least 61 members ) , the coalition leader becomes Prime Minister .
#Text=I am willing to go to great lengths in the negotiations needed to establish such a government .
#Text=— Benjamin Netanyahuvia JPost.com
#Text=Netanyahu will reach out to Kadima first after the announcement of his selection as possible Prime Minister .
#Text=He will extend several key cabinet position to Kadima .
#Text=Also , he will be contacting the Labor Party as a possible coalition partner .
#Text=During the election campaign , Netanyahu stated that not forming a national-unity government when we was previously Prime Minister was a mistake .
#Text=According to Netanyahu 's associates , they expect that it is likely that neither Kadima nor Labor will join a Lukid led coalition government .
#Text=A right-wing government of 65 seats with Shas ( 11 seats ) as the third party is expected .
#Text=Peres consulted with 10 of 12 parties with seats in Knesset .
#Text=Parties with the total of 65 seats recommend Netanyahu to lead the next government .
#Text=Besides Likud and Beiteinu , Habayit Hayehudi , Shas , National Union and United Torah Judaism indicated a preference for Netanyahu .
#Text=Other parties ( Meretz , Balad , Labor , Hadash and the United Arab List-Ta'al ) made no suggestion .
#Text=Labor chairman and Defense Minister Ehud Barak indicated Thursday that the Labor is preparing to operating as part of the opposition to the government .
#Text=He also indicated that Tzipi Livni was not recommended to the President due to the deal that she offered to Our Home .
#Text=The choice of Netanyahu has not encouraged Palestinian officials .
#Text=Netanyahu has been on the record as saying that he supports settlement expansion and believes that negotiations with Palestine are a waste of time .
#Text=Palestinian president Mahmoud Abbas has said that there will be no negotiation as long as settlement expansion continues .

#Text=Furthermore the coalition between Likud and Avigdor Lieberman 's party would be a huge blow to the Palestinian 's mainly because of Lieberman 's refusal to negotiate the question of whether or not to divide the city of Jerusalem , a city which Palestinians have hoped to make their capital for a Palestinian state .
